title: Captain | pt 8
body:
Alrighty this took a long time and i was a sad bitch while writing it so its sad i’m sorry but hey at least its finally up and also I have finally found the solution to my posting problem so it shouldn’t take me as long to update the next part, but thank to you all for a 1000 followers and heres to a 1000 more!!! enjoy this my beautiful bitches, you guys deserve it!!!!

Words: 3300+ (i’m not even sorry anymore)

Warnings: angst angst angst, i think some fluff if you squint, also angst, i can’t remember but I think theres like one swear? oh and did i mention angst

Pairing: Steve Rogers x stark!reader

MASTERLIST

A few days later, you and Steve were getting ready to leave Wakanda. Over that few day course, Bucky had made the decision to temporarily go back on the ice until the technicians could figure out how to stop his Russian mind control problem.

They said it would probably only be a few weeks at most, as they were highly advanced in the medical and technological field. He just wanted to be sure he wouldn’t hurt anyone until they could figure it out. He knew what he was like when he wasn’t in control.

After he went under, Steve and you had devised a plan to break everyone out of the prison. Sharon Carter had given him the whereabouts of the floating Alcatraz and soon you guys arranged how you were going to do it.

You would pilot the ship, hovering it over the sea and he would swim out to the imprisonment. Simultaneously you would use your tech wiz skills to knock out the security so he could not only get in, but get himself and several others out.

You would then stall the lockdown alert from getting to the mainland security just in time for you guys to get far away from the scene in order to keep them from tracking you.

It was the perfect plan and you were ready to help your captain at all costs, especially if it meant getting your team back. They were the closest thing you had to a family, and soon you would all be back together.

Suiting up was a lot more fun, Shurri and her tech crew had amped up the wow factor a little bit by adding micro tech and vibranium in your suit. It was cool to see it practically slither around your body. The normal silver metal was lined with glowing purple as it shined through the cracks. The arc reactor also had a purple glow to it now.

Looking across the room, Steve had strapped his gloves on, nodding to you to signify he was ready to go.

“You ready to do this?” he asked you, you nodding as soon as he did.

“Born ready.”

You saw the familiar smirk form on his face at the phrase. You both stood up, collecting your things before heading down to the quinjet. T’challa stood there, holding two small devices in his hand, they looked almost like compasses but you couldn’t be sure.

“Captain. I have something for you and the iron maiden.” He glanced in your direction at the last part, making you blush from the nickname. He then placed the small devices in both of your hands, even you were not sure what they were.

“These are homing beacons. If you press that button, we can track you and find you if you’re in need of help. You may not need them, but just in case.”

You were so entranced in the small thing, you almost ignored what he said.

“Thank you T’challa, for everything. What you’ve done will always make me an ally.” Steve finished as he shook the young king’s hand.

“As long as you are an ally, Barnes will be well taken care of.” He smiled, before turning to you. You had become quite fond of him the last few days, as you’d spent some time conversing over the amazing technology of the place.

“And as for you, miss iron girl… you are welcome here anytime you wish to stay.” He smiled warmly before crossing his arms over his chest in an x shape, nodding to you both before he walked away.

You and Steve climbed aboard the transport, not even giving a second glance back when you closed the ramp. Taking your seat next to him you buckled yourself in, feeling the right straps hold you in place. You glanced up to your left, eyes meeting his with a smirk.

“Let’s go get em’ Cap.”

-

Later that evening everyone was huddled together inside the quinjet, which you guys had chosen to land in the mountains so no one could find you. You were careful not to let anyone or anything track you after you successfully accomplished the rescue.

They were all a bit shaken up, but now that you’d gotten them back they were okay.

Wanda hadn’t really talked all night, but you figured you could change that pretty easily. You went over and sat by her. You opened your mouth to speak but she beat you to it.

“Y/n, I know that we are free. But they’re still going to be after us. They will chase us down if they have to. Your father is going to enforce that by any means,” she paused to rethink what she was about to say. “I think that maybe all of us should split up. Make it harder for them to get us.”

When she finished you knew where she was coming from, and in all sense it really would have been the smart thing to do, but it would take a lot of convincing for Steve to let it happen. He always wanted everyone to stick together.

Contemplating her words, and figuring out a way to make the plan possible, you nodded your head to her. She looked down at her hands then back up to you.

“That’s not to say we should leave each other right away. This would take some planning. I do have an idea though of where we can hide before we figure everything out.”

You turned your head, now intrigued at the place she had in mind. Knowing her it would be a safe place to possibly stay the week in. Maybe even longer, if needed be.

“I’ll talk to Steve.” You nodded towards her and She gave you a smirk.

“How are things going with Steve?” she chided, knowing full well of the ‘complicated relationship’ you two had been blooming over the years.

“They're…. Going.” You cut short, not wanting to go into full detail about your love confession right now. She just rolled her eyes and shrugged, not forcing you to speak about it any further.

“The place is a bunker not far from here,” she spoke up again, changing the subject as quick as she could. “We could probably make it there by nightfall.”

“You think you could fly the ship there?” You asked softly, slinking back in your seat as you spoke.

“Yes. But we’d have to get moving.”

“I’ll get right on that then.”

You stood up from you seat and over to Steve where Wanda watched you speak with him about the matter. She saw him look at you with a stern look before relaxing a bit and nodding his head. He turned to look at Maximoff, nodding his head at her too, giving her the signal that it was okay to fly the ship to a new place. She stood up and smiled, walking to the front of the transport and using her powers to get everything started up.

The flight wasn’t long, even shorter than she had said it would be, and you all touched down before the sun set completely.

Outside was a small motel, no more than 20 rooms possibly, but it was low key and would for sure keep you guys hidden and safe from the public for the time being. You all unloaded and Sam went in and got rooms for everyone.

He came out about a minute later, holding key cards in his hands.

“I could only get 3 rooms. Some of us are gonna have to bunk up.” He said passing them around.

“I can go with Scott.” Clint took one of the key cards, heading in the direction of the rooms to put his stuff down.

“I’ll go with Wanda.” You said, heading in the same direction as Clint with Wanda following close behind.

“Guess you’re stuck with me cap.” Sam smirked and elbowed Steve in the arm making him chuckle.

“Guess so.”

They soon followed suit of the rest of you, heading into their rooms as well. Each room had two queen sized beds, although the quality wasn’t the greatest, you were okay to be there as long as it was a safe roof over your heads.

As the time passed the next day, you made sure to tell Steve about Wanda’s plan to split up. He though it was genuinely a good idea as you would need to keep a low profile and traveling in a big group would draw attention.

To your surprise, someone came knocking on your door later in the afternoon. It was Natasha. You welcomed her with warm open arms as you knew she wasn’t there to take any of you guys in. Steve had told you what she did for the team, so everyone was happy to welcome not only her but Vision into the group. He followed along because he didn’t want to be away from Wanda in case anything happened.

Steve was almost worried about it but then later that night something happened that he did not expect. A phone call. A phone call from a number that belonged to the flip phone he had sent Tony in a the mail a few days prior.

He hesitantly picked it up, answering it as best he could. Tony immediately started talking.

“Steve. I didn’t think I would do this, but I know she’s with you. How is she?” he asked, speeding out his words with a wavering voice.

“She’s fine, she’s been warn out but she’s fine.” He replied, sitting down on the edge of the bed. Sam was in the shower at the time so Steve didn’t have to worry about having him eavesdropping.

“Where are you guys?”

“Tony you know I can’t tell you that.”

Tony heaved a heavy breath before sighing at those words.

“I deserve to know where my daughter is Rogers. I can’t be sure she’s safe if I don’t.”

“Tony I would never let anything happen to her. Ever. I will keep her safe at all costs.” He was quick to tell him what he would do for you, letting him know his intentions.

“Steve if you’re planning to run you can’t bring her with you.” He spoke with a sincere voice, trying to approach the situation calmly.

“Tony I told you I won’t let anything happen to her.”

“That might not be your decision cap. If they find you and she’s with you, they won’t hesitate to grab her as soon as you let your guard down. You know that.” In his mind it made sense to bring you with him, but the way Tony put it was the more logical thing that might happen.

“What do you suppose I do then, I can’t just leave her?”

“I know you’re stashing Barnes somewhere, if she stays in one place away from you she won’t get caught. Take her there and make sure she’ll be safe.”

Steve covered half his face with his hand, stressed out at the conversation. He is not only worried about you, but also conflicted because he wants to keep you with him. He thought about it for a moment before responding.

“Alright.”

“Alright?”

“Deal. I’ll put her somewhere safe but you have to promise not to try and find her yourself. I promise you she’ll be safe.”

“I can promise that.” Tony said before abruptly hang in up the phone. Little did Steve know that was the last time he would talk to Tony for a long time.

Sitting on the edge of his bed, head in his hands, he had to think about how he was going to tell you. How he was going to leave you. He didn’t want to, he would give anything not to. But he promised Tony he would do it for your safety, and your safety was more important than anything.

As if on cue, he heard crying coming from next door. He was about to stand up and walk out the door but as soon as he did he saw Natasha standing in front of him.

You and her were now bunking up because Vision insisted on staying with Wanda.

She woke up when you started crying and went to get Steve right away.

“Steve she keeps saying your name I figured I should get you.” He nodded and immediately went in to calm you down. Natasha went inside his room and got settled in, figuring that you would want Steve to stay with you tonight.

It was dark. There was a single light in the distance. Under the light was a small table with a knife and a note laying on top of it. The knife was covered in blood and when you looked down your hands were too.

You turned around at a loud sound, it sounded like a gun shot. You saw someone standing in the dark holding the gun, but it was pointed towards you. When you looked down there was a bullet hole right in your abdomen where you’d been shot before.

The blood dropped down your body and onto your legs. You lost your balance and came crashing to the floor. You struggled to breathe and with all the blood you were losing, you were struggling to stay awake as well.

That was when you saw him. Steve came rushing to your side, holding you close to him. He had tears dripping down his face as he looked at you. He looked up towards the dark figure in the shadows holding a gun and shouted.

“Not her, me.”

You were about to go completely into the darkness when you heard it again. A gunshot even louder than the first one sounded through your head. You suddenly were wide awake and had a surge of strength return to your body. You sat up and turned to the side, seeing Steve now laying instead on the floor, the life slowly draining from him. Bullet hole right in the middle of his chest as he laid there.

You clung to him as right as you could, lowering your face to kiss his lips once, twice and then tree times. It did nothing, he was still dying there in your arms.

“Steve please don’t leave me. Please don’t leave me I love you Steve please. No.” You cried, but your cries went unanswered, his eyes finally closing and his breath stopping.

You were shaken awake by a familiar presence, breathing fast as it all came crashing down. Your teary eyes opened to see Steve sitting next to you and you pulled him close to you, practically squeezing the life out of him as you did.

“Shh angel it’s okay, I’ve got you doll, I’m here.” He soothed, putting his other hand to the back of our head, cradling you head close to him.

“You’re here. You’re okay.” You began to stop the tears that flowed, slowing your breathing and running your hands up and down his back.

He pulled back from you at arms length, cupping your face with his hand, stroking your cheek with his thumb.

“Wanna talk about it?”

You were slightly hesitant at first, but then relaxed a bit, knowing that Steve was here for you and always was. Knowing that he adored you and would help you with this.

“I was back in that room. There was a knife, it had blood on it, my blood. I heard a gunshot and the bullet went through me and I didn’t even know it. You were there. You were with me but then he shot you. I wasn’t hurt anymore but you died.” Your breathing was rapid again, talking about it this time didn’t seem to be helping you.

“Doll I’m okay, I’m here,” he kept trying to calm you down but to no avail, You kept shaking and began crying again. “Angel I’ve got you.”

“Steve please promise me you’ll never leave me. I need you. Please promise me Steve.” You could not even start to describe what would happen to you if something happened to him. You didn’t want to think about what you might do to yourself, but it wouldn’t be pretty.

“I-I don’t know if I can promise that. Doll I have to tell you something.” He lifted you chin so your eyes met his, tear streaked cheeks and all gazing up at him.

“Steve please tell me whatever it is won’t separate us. I can’t do it. Not without you.” You cried harder and harder, trying to contemplate what he was actually trying to say to you.

“Angel it’ll be okay. You are so strong. Tony called me, he thinks it might be a good idea to take you to Wakanda with Bucky. You’ll be safe there and-“ I

“No Steve, please don’t. Don’t leave me there please. Steve let me come with you.” You were having a full blown panic attack by now, not able to keep a coherent thought except for to try and convince him to stay with you.

“Baby doll I can’t put you in danger. Tony said they’d come for you. I’m not risking it, I can’t risk it.” He tried to reason with you but you weren’t having it. You were not letting this one go. Every other time you would sit on the sidelines because Steve insists it was for you safety, but not this time. You weren’t going down this time without a fight. You dried your tears as best you could, trying to make your voice as level as possible.

“Steve no. I’m not going to stay back without you. I need you. And as long as we’re together it’s worth the risk. I can handle myself and I want to be there for you.” You spoke with a shaky, yet somewhat composed voice, but he knew how you were feeling on the inside, and this was killing him.

“Y/n this isn’t about me, it’s about you.”

His intentions seemed to be only one sided, and you knew just by looking at him that he didn’t want to do this as much as you didn’t.

“Steve it is not just about me. What if something happened to you and I wasn’t there. That would haunt me forever. Steve I already have dreams about it. If I wasn’t there I don’t know what I’d do.” You reached up to his face, trying to make him look you in the eye, as before then he’d been looking anywhere but you. “Steve we can’t just split up purely because my dad said something about it to you. For all we know he could have just said that to get you to leave me somewhere so he can come get me himself.”

“Do you really believe he would do that?” this time it was you who didn’t want to look him in the eye. Your dad wouldn’t do that to you, not in a million years. He was the one who let you go, to be with Steve and fight with him.

“No.”

“Maybe there’s a way we can compromise. I don’t want to leave you so I won’t. But here’s the deal, wherever we go to hide out, you have to stay unless I’m there with you to go out. And if there’s even one instance where they come after you, then I’m gonna take you to Wakanda.” This was the ultimatum, but fortunately for you, it was a good one and meant you’d get to stay with him.

“Deal.” You sniffled once more, and held your hand out for him to shake, which he did with a soft smile.

“That’s my girl.” He let go of your hand and wrapped his arms around your small frame. You tucked your head under his chin with your face buried in his chest. “Do you want me to stay with you tonight?”

“Isn’t Natasha supposed to be in here?”

“No she switched with me so I could stay with you.”

You nodded your head and laid down, him gently doing the same behind you and bringing his arms around your waist like he did at home. But that wasn’t really your home, neither was anywhere else. You were home right in this moment, with Steve. He was your home and he always would be.

With peace and a now sound mind, you and Steve fell into a quiet slumber.

Tags:

@h0tshotstark @stickyqueenbouquetsstuff @vxidnik @oliviaharddyy @sunflowersun0212 @gwynethjodie

It was the perfect plan and you were ready to help your captain at all costs, especially if it meant getting your team back. They were the closest thing you had to a family, and soon you would all be back together.

It was cool to see it practically slither around your body. The normal silver metal was lined with glowing purple as it shined through the cracks. The arc reactor also had a purple glow to it now.

They soon followed suit of the rest of you, heading into their rooms as well. Each room had two queen sized beds, although the quality wasn’t the greatest, you were okay to be there as long as it was a safe roof over your heads.

As the time passed the next day, you made sure to tell Steve about Wanda’s plan to split up. He though it was genuinely a good idea as you would need to keep a low profile and traveling in a big group would draw attention.

To your surprise, someone came knocking on your door later in the afternoon. It was Natasha. You welcomed her with warm open arms as you knew she wasn’t there to take any of you guys in. Steve had told you what she did for the team, so everyone was happy to welcome not only her but Vision into the group. He followed along because he didn’t want to be away from Wanda in case anything happened.

Steve was almost worried about it but then later that night something happened that he did not expect. A phone call. A phone call from a number that belonged to the flip phone he had sent Tony in a the mail a few days prior.

He hesitantly picked it up, answering it as best he could. Tony immediately started talking.

“Steve. I didn’t think I would do this, but I know she’s with you. How is she?” he asked, speeding out his words with a wavering voice.

“She’s fine, she’s been warn out but she’s fine.” He replied, sitting down on the edge of the bed. Sam was in the shower at the time so Steve didn’t have to worry about having him eavesdropping.

“Where are you guys?”

“Tony you know I can’t tell you that.”

Tony heaved a heavy breath before sighing at those words.

“I deserve to know where my daughter is Rogers. I can’t be sure she’s safe if I don’t.”

“Tony I would never let anything happen to her. Ever. I will keep her safe at all costs.” He was quick to tell him what he would do for you, letting him know his intentions.

“Steve if you’re planning to run you can’t bring her with you.” He spoke with a sincere voice, trying to approach the situation calmly.

“Tony I told you I won’t let anything happen to her.”

“That might not be your decision cap. If they find you and she’s with you, they won’t hesitate to grab her as soon as you let your guard down. You know that.” In his mind it made sense to bring you with him, but the way Tony put it was the more logical thing that might happen.

“What do you suppose I do then, I can’t just leave her?”

“I know you’re stashing Barnes somewhere, if she stays in one place away from you she won’t get caught. Take her there and make sure she’ll be safe.”

Steve covered half his face with his hand, stressed out at the conversation. He is not only worried about you, but also conflicted because he wants to keep you with him. He thought about it for a moment before responding.

“Alright.”

“Alright?”

“Deal. I’ll put her somewhere safe but you have to promise not to try and find her yourself. I promise you she’ll be safe.”

“I can promise that.” Tony said before abruptly hang in up the phone. Little did Steve know that was the last time he would talk to Tony for a long time.

Sitting on the edge of his bed, head in his hands, he had to think about how he was going to tell you. How he was going to leave you. He didn’t want to, he would give anything not to. But he promised Tony he would do it for your safety, and your safety was more important than anything.

As if on cue, he heard crying coming from next door. He was about to stand up and walk out the door but as soon as he did he saw Natasha standing in front of him.

You and her were now bunking up because Vision insisted on staying with Wanda.

She woke up when you started crying and went to get Steve right away.

“Steve she keeps saying your name I figured I should get you.” He nodded and immediately went in to calm you down. Natasha went inside his room and got settled in, figuring that you would want Steve to stay with you tonight.

It was dark. There was a single light in the distance. Under the light was a small table with a knife and a note laying on top of it. The knife was covered in blood and when you looked down your hands were too.

You turned around at a loud sound, it sounded like a gun shot. You saw someone standing in the dark holding the gun, but it was pointed towards you. When you looked down there was a bullet hole right in your abdomen where you’d been shot before.

The blood dropped down your body and onto your legs. You lost your balance and came crashing to the floor. You struggled to breathe and with all the blood you were losing, you were struggling to stay awake as well.

That was when you saw him. Steve came rushing to your side, holding you close to him. He had tears dripping down his face as he looked at you. He looked up towards the dark figure in the shadows holding a gun and shouted.

“Not her, me.”

You were about to go completely into the darkness when you heard it again. A gunshot even louder than the first one sounded through your head. You suddenly were wide awake and had a surge of strength return to your body. You sat up and turned to the side, seeing Steve now laying instead on the floor, the life slowly draining from him. Bullet hole right in the middle of his chest as he laid there.

You clung to him as right as you could, lowering your face to kiss his lips once, twice and then tree times. It did nothing, he was still dying there in your arms.

“Steve please don’t leave me. Please don’t leave me I love you Steve please. No.” You cried, but your cries went unanswered, his eyes finally closing and his breath stopping.

You were shaken awake by a familiar presence, breathing fast as it all came crashing down. Your teary eyes opened to see Steve sitting next to you and you pulled him close to you, practically squeezing the life out of him as you did.

“Shh angel it’s okay, I’ve got you doll, I’m here.” He soothed, putting his other hand to the back of our head, cradling you head close to him.

“You’re here. You’re okay.” You began to stop the tears that flowed, slowing your breathing and running your hands up and down his back.

He pulled back from you at arms length, cupping your face with his hand, stroking your cheek with his thumb.

“Wanna talk about it?”

You were slightly hesitant at first, but then relaxed a bit, knowing that Steve was here for you and always was. Knowing that he adored you and would help you with this.

“I was back in that room. There was a knife, it had blood on it, my blood. I heard a gunshot and the bullet went through me and I didn’t even know it. You were there. You were with me but then he shot you. I wasn’t hurt anymore but you died.” Your breathing was rapid again, talking about it this time didn’t seem to be helping you.

“Doll I’m okay, I’m here,” he kept trying to calm you down but to no avail, You kept shaking and began crying again. “Angel I’ve got you.”

“Steve please promise me you’ll never leave me. I need you. Please promise me Steve.” You could not even start to describe what would happen to you if something happened to him. You didn’t want to think about what you might do to yourself, but it wouldn’t be pretty.

“I-I don’t know if I can promise that. Doll I have to tell you something.” He lifted you chin so your eyes met his, tear streaked cheeks and all gazing up at him.

“Steve please tell me whatever it is won’t separate us. I can’t do it. Not without you.” You cried harder and harder, trying to contemplate what he was actually trying to say to you.

“Angel it’ll be okay. You are so strong. Tony called me, he thinks it might be a good idea to take you to Wakanda with Bucky. You’ll be safe there and-“ I

“No Steve, please don’t. Don’t leave me there please. Steve let me come with you.” You were having a full blown panic attack by now, not able to keep a coherent thought except for to try and convince him to stay with you.

“Baby doll I can’t put you in danger. Tony said they’d come for you. I’m not risking it, I can’t risk it.” He tried to reason with you but you weren’t having it. You were not letting this one go. Every other time you would sit on the sidelines because Steve insists it was for you safety, but not this time. You weren’t going down this time without a fight. You dried your tears as best you could, trying to make your voice as level as possible.

“Steve no. I’m not going to stay back without you. I need you. And as long as we’re together it’s worth the risk. I can handle myself and I want to be there for you.” You spoke with a shaky, yet somewhat composed voice, but he knew how you were feeling on the inside, and this was killing him.

“Y/n this isn’t about me, it’s about you.”

His intentions seemed to be only one sided, and you knew just by looking at him that he didn’t want to do this as much as you didn’t.

“Steve it is not just about me. What if something happened to you and I wasn’t there. That would haunt me forever. Steve I already have dreams about it. If I wasn’t there I don’t know what I’d do.” You reached up to his face, trying to make him look you in the eye, as before then he’d been looking anywhere but you. “Steve we can’t just split up purely because my dad said something about it to you. For all we know he could have just said that to get you to leave me somewhere so he can come get me himself.”

“Do you really believe he would do that?” this time it was you who didn’t want to look him in the eye. Your dad wouldn’t do that to you, not in a million years. He was the one who let you go, to be with Steve and fight with him.

“No.”

“Maybe there’s a way we can compromise. I don’t want to leave you so I won’t. But here’s the deal, wherever we go to hide out, you have to stay unless I’m there with you to go out. And if there’s even one instance where they come after you, then I’m gonna take you to Wakanda.” This was the ultimatum, but fortunately for you, it was a good one and meant you’d get to stay with him.

“Deal.” You sniffled once more, and held your hand out for him to shake, which he did with a soft smile.

“That’s my girl.” He let go of your hand and wrapped his arms around your small frame. You tucked your head under his chin with your face buried in his chest. “Do you want me to stay with you tonight?”

“Isn’t Natasha supposed to be in here?”

“No she switched with me so I could stay with you.”

You nodded your head and laid down, him gently doing the same behind you and bringing his arms around your waist like he did at home. But that wasn’t really your home, neither was anywhere else. You were home right in this moment, with Steve. He was your home and he always would be.

With peace and a now sound mind, you and Steve fell into a quiet slumber.

body:
Luca (And Dodger) 2 Months

Rated: G

Pairing: Chris Evans/Sebastian Stan

Summary: Dodger reacts to the new arrival.

Warnings: mentions of Neonatal Abstinince Syndrome in passing.

-

Flying with a two month old had been no joke. Poor little Luca had been fussy and uncomfortable the whole time. And on top of that, they’d been in coach. They’d gotten an array of both sympathetic looks and annoyed ones from a number of passengers while walking him up and down the aisle to try and console him a little bit. He hadn’t completely calmed down until they were on the ground again. Thankfully, he hadn’t been seizing or trembling at all since they left the hospital. The treatments had seemed to work. They’d still have to keep a close eye on him for the following month but it really seemed like the withdrawals were over.

-

Currently they were in their SUV on the way home. Sebastian was sitting in the back seat with Luca. Luca was greedily drinking from his bottle. His little greenish-blue eyes looking up at his dad from underneath a soft little baby blue hat. His tiny hands were still covered with mittens so he didn’t hurt himself And his small body was swaddled to keep him calm and warm. It was fall but it felt like winter here in New England.

“You done?” Sebastian asked as he pulled the bottle away. Luca snuffed and murmured and his little arms flailed in an answer. Sebastian lifted him out of the seat to put him over his shoulder to burp him and with two good burps he pulled him away whispering praises.

“Ah, good burp, good for you,” he said. As he put him back into his car seat and buckled him back up. Chris looked up and smiled as he caught a glimpse of the two in his rear view. Sebastian then took a moment to look outside. They were almost home. Another ten minutes and they’d be there.

-

The sun was just beginning it’s slow decent in the sky. It was a little after midday when Chris pulled into their garage. The car turned off and the two new parents got out of the car. Chris got the luggage from the trunk while Sebastian handled Luca. Luca was quietly wiggling around in his car seat looking around with wonder and trying to fit his covered hands into his mouth. He made a happy little cooing sound as he was moved from the car and carried by Sebastian over to the stairs to get inside.

“Dodger’s here, do you think we should introduce them now?”

“Yeah, sure, he’s been around plenty of babies and children before, but let me go in and greet him separately first and then we can switch so he has a moment to get excited before we bring Luca in. You know he gets excited when we come home,” Sebastian nodded.

Chris went in first. He put the keys down on the counter and called out for Dodger in a moment the happy mutt was barreling towards him. Tongue lulling out and and jumping up at him, they hadn’t seen each other in two and a half weeks so the excitement was warranted.

“Hey bubba! Hey, yes. I missed you too! I missed you so much,” Dodger happily yipped and jumped and licked at Chris’s face as he greeted him. “Good boy,” Chris said. “Now stay,” Dodger stayed where he was asked. Tail wagging happily. A few moments later Sebastian entered and was given the same treatment as Chris with happily excited licks to the face and paws on his shoulders as he knelt down to greet him.

“You are such a good boy, I missed you too, yes I did, you’re the best,” he praised the dog and continued to generously pet him all over. “Now, guess what? We’ve got someone for you to meet, come here,” he said, he clipped Dodger’s leash on him. Dodger looked confused. They knew he’d just been on a walk because their Dog Walker had just updated them that he’d been on one before they came home.

“You’ll see,” he promised the dog. He knocked on the outside door that led to the garage to signal that it was okay for Chris to come inside with the baby. The door opened slowly and Chris stepped inside. Luca in the car seat. Dodgers ears immediately perked up when he heard the soft sounds of the baby cooing and gurgling from the seat he did a little round about, walking in a circle. His tail wagging as he got closer to Chris who was holding the carriage up high.

“Dodger, this is your new little brother, do you want to say hi? If so you have to sit,” he told the dog. Dodger sat down, right there in the side of the entrance way and let his tail thump on the ground lightly as he waited for farther instruction. Slowly Chris lowered the carriage to the floor, telling Dodger to stay as he did so. Dodger didn’t move from his spot as Chris waited.

“Good boy,” Chris told Dodger and that was Dodger’s cue to stand. As if on instinct he came up to the baby carriage and sniffed around. Not licking or jumping or doing anything wrong. He’d been around babies before but it was like he was taking extra care around this one. He kept his distance and didn’t put his face into the seat. Staying around the boarder as he sniffed. Luca cooed again, little hands coming out far enough to touch Dodger. Dodger just let the baby gently bat at him. Finally he got closer. His nose gently nudging at Luca’s little head as he sniffed him. Luca’s head moved as he tried to follow the dog’s movements. Neither one seemed distressed. Only curious about one and other. Dodger slowly sniffed down Luca’s little body before sitting down in front of the baby carrier. He tilted his head one way and then another before leaning in again and getting right up into Luca’s face.

“Whoa, Dodger-“ Sebastian cut himself off when Luca gave a happy squeal snuffle and his arms flailed around as Dodger licked the side of his face. Luca was laughing. It was a sound they’d only heard one other time and it warned both of their hearts to hear it for the second time directed back at Dodger. Dodger didn’t bark or startle at the sudden loud noise. He just sniffed again at the top of Luca’s head before sitting back and then looking up at Chris. A wide doggy smile on his face. As if to say “I like it, what is it? Are we keeping it?” All in one. Chris gave Dodger a pat on the head and told him he was a good boy once again as he went to get a baby wipe from the counter to wipe off Luca’s face from dog slobber. After Luca was clean Sebastian headed upstairs with him nestled into his arms, while Chris took a moment to take a few work phone calls he’d been putting off. Dodger followed Sebastian up stairs. Taking the steps two by two and arriving at the top first. Dodger trotted over to the nursery without prompting. A very smart dog indeed, Sebastian thought. He smiled at Dodger as he entered into the room. Dodger followed him inside. Sebastian took a seat in the comfortable rocker. He unswaddled Luca partway, Not wanting him to overheat inside. He let the blanket draped across his arm and lap as he held Luca on top of it as he rocked him slowly to sleep. It didn’t take long, the baby was tired. Dodger had taken a vigilant watch a few feet away from Sebastian. He was relaxed but still alert. Lying on his stomach but with his head up and panting. Ready to jump up at a moments notice of danger. When Sebastian stood Dodger did as well. Sebastian slowly lowered Luca into the crib, he turned the mobile above his crib on, it was a set of glowing stars and moons. The mobile could be hooked up through Bluetooth to play lullabies or simply just spin and twinkle. He put it on the latter setting this time. Dodger sat by the crib. Watching as Sebastian brushed a soft hand over Luca’s tiny head before he leaned against the crib to just watch him sleep for a while. Luca didn’t move much in his sleep. Occasionally he smacked his little lips together and his hand would twitch but there were no violent seizing motions or twitches like there had been early on before the withdrawal. Then it had been hard to watch him sleep. Too painful of a reminder that there was nothing more they could do to help his pain and suffering, now that he was sleeping calmly Sebastian felt like he could watch him for hours as his tiny chest rose and fell Sebastian felt himself falling more and more in love.

Finally after another fifteen minutes of watching him sleep Sebastian straightened up. Out of the corner of his eye he saw Dodger stand at attention as well. Sebastian reached down to pet him.

“Good boy,” he said, “come on, this way, let’s let him sleep.” Sebastian was standing in the door frame. He hadn’t heard he tinkle of Dodger’s collar following so he looked back. Dodger looked unsure as he stood between Luca and Sebastian. He glanced back at Luca in the crib, as if to say, “you’re just gonna leave him? Are you sure that he’s gonna be okay?” As if to prove his thoughts Dodger turned his head back and gave a little whine. Sebastian chuffed at the sweet gesture.

“Come on bud, he’ll be fine. He needs to sleep for now. You two can hang out later,” he told him. And with a few more cursory glances back Dodger finally trotted over to the open door. Sebastian hooked the baby monitor to his belt and turned the volume all the way up as he cracked the door behind him.

-

Sebastian reached the top of the stairs ready to head down. Once again caught off guard when Dodger wasn’t at his heels. He looked back, Dodger was again glancing back at the half closed door. Sebastian let out a low chuckle,

“Come on Bub, Luca will be okay, I promise,” Sebastian went back over to Dodger and knelt down in front of him to scratch him behind the ear.

“I promise, he’ll be okay, let’s let him sleep for now, you want to go outside? Dad brought you back some new dog treats? Maybe we can play fetch, huh? How does that sound?” He asked Dodger at the word “Treats” and “outside” his ears perked up and he was following Sebastian down the stairs with a pep in his steps.

-

The next day Chris had Luca propped up in a baby chair in the living room as he sorted through a pile of paperwork. Sebastian was somewhere else in the house doing some sort of chore. Probably laundry. But Chris didn’t know. Every few moments he’d find himself looking up and smiling at the sight in front of him. Luca was in his chair playfully batting at the dangling rattling, crinkly, and shiny objects hanging from the handle above him while dodger lied out half curled around the chair with his head in his paws. Dodger had really taken to the two month old in the last 24 hours. As soon as Sebastian had woken up at the cries in the middle of the night Dodger had too. He had followed Sebastian into the baby’s room and stayed with Sebastian and Luca until Luca was quiet and sleeping again. This happened three more times throughout the night and each time Dodger was up and alert and ready to protect and watch. He even did his own check of the crib every time before leaving the room and it warmed Sebastian and Chris’s hearts to see.

-

Luca was in his baby carrier crying his eyes out. They’d taken him to the doctor after the fourth day of near constant crying. Dodger, the poor pup, had only been able to take so much before retreating outside to his Doghouse. It wasn’t colic and Sebastian and Chris were glad of that. They’d done all they could think of. He didn’t need a change, he didn’t want food, didn’t need to be burped, rocked, held, or anything else. It was breaking Chris’s heart to have to watch and was quite frankly, driving Sebastian slightly mad. But he remained calm. Doing all he could think of. Currently Luca was in his carrier on the floor, still bawling his little hands and legs flailing as he did so. Chris came in from Dodger’s morning walk. Unlike usual for the past few days Dodger didn’t immediately head outside. This time he slowly and cautiously walked up to the carriage. Chris was about to call him back but Dodger didn’t bark or pounce, he instead placed his paw on it and began to rock it slightly. Still crying, Luca opened his eyes. And for the first time in a few hours he paused in his crying. His hands coming out and reaching for the dog. Dodger moves forward. He began licking Luca’s head and Luca’s little fists fisted themselves in his fur. Dodger pulled away and stopped licking but he sat down, resting his body over the baby carrier completely and just lying there. Chris and Sebastian watched on with awe as Luca slowly stopped crying his cries fading to quiet whimpers and then silence before soft and content cooing sounds replaced them as Luca continued to run his little hands through Dodger’s fur.

“Well would you look at that?” Chris commented coming over to Sebastian. Sebastian was still shocked himself.

“You couldn’t have tried this three days ago Dodge?” He wondered aloud. Chris laughed,

“He’s a Good boy,”

“That he is,” Sebastian said as he sighed. Closing his eyes for a moment and relishing in the silence for the first time in days.

-

From then on whenever Luca would start wailing Dodger would come running. If Luca was crying in his crib Dodger would stick a paw or a snout through the bars and as soon as Luca saw him he’d begin to calm down. It was almost like magic. When Luca would be playing on his play mat during the day dodger would sit and watch from his spot close by where the sun would shine in through the window. When Luca would push a ball a little out of his reach (before he started crawling) Dodger would be sure to nudge it back before the whimpering started.

Dodger was taking his duties as big brother very seriously and it warmed Chris’s heart the most to see baby and dog bonding so well.

The only place they drew the line at was when Luca was sleeping at night. Dodger wasn’t allowed in the room and there was a baby gate that opened and closed for that reason at Luca’s door. Dodger was the best baby monitor there was at night though, because he’d be jumping onto Chris and Sebastian’s bed before the cries got loud enough to wake them up to let them know Luca was up and needing attention.

He let the blanket draped across his arm and lap as he held Luca on top of it as he rocked him slowly to sleep. It didn’t take long, the baby was tired. Dodger had taken a vigilant watch a few feet away from Sebastian. He was relaxed but still alert. Lying on his stomach but with his head up and panting. Ready to jump up at a moments notice of danger. When Sebastian stood Dodger did as well. Sebastian slowly lowered Luca into the crib, he turned the mobile above his crib on, it was a set of glowing stars and moons. The mobile could be hooked up through Bluetooth to play lullabies or simply just spin and twinkle. He put it on the latter setting this time. Dodger sat by the crib. Watching as Sebastian brushed a soft hand over Luca’s tiny head before he leaned against the crib to just watch him sleep for a while. Luca didn’t move much in his sleep. Occasionally he smacked his little lips together and his hand would twitch but there were no violent seizing motions or twitches like there had been early on before the withdrawal. Then it had been hard to watch him sleep. Too painful of a reminder that there was nothing more they could do to help his pain and suffering, now that he was sleeping calmly Sebastian felt like he could watch him for hours as his tiny chest rose and fell Sebastian felt himself falling more and more in love.

Finally after another fifteen minutes of watching him sleep Sebastian straightened up. Out of the corner of his eye he saw Dodger stand at attention as well. Sebastian reached down to pet him.

“Good boy,” he said, “come on, this way, let’s let him sleep.” Sebastian was standing in the door frame. He hadn’t heard he tinkle of Dodger’s collar following so he looked back. Dodger looked unsure as he stood between Luca and Sebastian. He glanced back at Luca in the crib, as if to say, “you’re just gonna leave him? Are you sure that he’s gonna be okay?” As if to prove his thoughts Dodger turned his head back and gave a little whine. Sebastian chuffed at the sweet gesture.

“Come on bud, he’ll be fine. He needs to sleep for now. You two can hang out later,” he told him. And with a few more cursory glances back Dodger finally trotted over to the open door. Sebastian hooked the baby monitor to his belt and turned the volume all the way up as he cracked the door behind him.

-

Sebastian reached the top of the stairs ready to head down. Once again caught off guard when Dodger wasn’t at his heels. He looked back, Dodger was again glancing back at the half closed door. Sebastian let out a low chuckle,

“Come on Bub, Luca will be okay, I promise,” Sebastian went back over to Dodger and knelt down in front of him to scratch him behind the ear.

“I promise, he’ll be okay, let’s let him sleep for now, you want to go outside? Dad brought you back some new dog treats? Maybe we can play fetch, huh? How does that sound?” He asked Dodger at the word “Treats” and “outside” his ears perked up and he was following Sebastian down the stairs with a pep in his steps.

-

The next day Chris had Luca propped up in a baby chair in the living room as he sorted through a pile of paperwork. Sebastian was somewhere else in the house doing some sort of chore. Probably laundry. But Chris didn’t know. Every few moments he’d find himself looking up and smiling at the sight in front of him. Luca was in his chair playfully batting at the dangling rattling, crinkly, and shiny objects hanging from the handle above him while dodger lied out half curled around the chair with his head in his paws. Dodger had really taken to the two month old in the last 24 hours. As soon as Sebastian had woken up at the cries in the middle of the night Dodger had too. He had followed Sebastian into the baby’s room and stayed with Sebastian and Luca until Luca was quiet and sleeping again. This happened three more times throughout the night and each time Dodger was up and alert and ready to protect and watch. He even did his own check of the crib every time before leaving the room and it warmed Sebastian and Chris’s hearts to see.

-

Luca was in his baby carrier crying his eyes out. They’d taken him to the doctor after the fourth day of near constant crying. Dodger, the poor pup, had only been able to take so much before retreating outside to his Doghouse. It wasn’t colic and Sebastian and Chris were glad of that. They’d done all they could think of. He didn’t need a change, he didn’t want food, didn’t need to be burped, rocked, held, or anything else. It was breaking Chris’s heart to have to watch and was quite frankly, driving Sebastian slightly mad. But he remained calm. Doing all he could think of. Currently Luca was in his carrier on the floor, still bawling his little hands and legs flailing as he did so. Chris came in from Dodger’s morning walk. Unlike usual for the past few days Dodger didn’t immediately head outside. This time he slowly and cautiously walked up to the carriage. Chris was about to call him back but Dodger didn’t bark or pounce, he instead placed his paw on it and began to rock it slightly. Still crying, Luca opened his eyes. And for the first time in a few hours he paused in his crying. His hands coming out and reaching for the dog. Dodger moves forward. He began licking Luca’s head and Luca’s little fists fisted themselves in his fur. Dodger pulled away and stopped licking but he sat down, resting his body over the baby carrier completely and just lying there. Chris and Sebastian watched on with awe as Luca slowly stopped crying his cries fading to quiet whimpers and then silence before soft and content cooing sounds replaced them as Luca continued to run his little hands through Dodger’s fur.

“Well would you look at that?” Chris commented coming over to Sebastian. Sebastian was still shocked himself.

“You couldn’t have tried this three days ago Dodge?” He wondered aloud. Chris laughed,

“He’s a Good boy,”

“That he is,” Sebastian said as he sighed. Closing his eyes for a moment and relishing in the silence for the first time in days.

-

From then on whenever Luca would start wailing Dodger would come running. If Luca was crying in his crib Dodger would stick a paw or a snout through the bars and as soon as Luca saw him he’d begin to calm down. It was almost like magic. When Luca would be playing on his play mat during the day dodger would sit and watch from his spot close by where the sun would shine in through the window. When Luca would push a ball a little out of his reach (before he started crawling) Dodger would be sure to nudge it back before the whimpering started.

Dodger was taking his duties as big brother very seriously and it warmed Chris’s heart the most to see baby and dog bonding so well.

The only place they drew the line at was when Luca was sleeping at night. Dodger wasn’t allowed in the room and there was a baby gate that opened and closed for that reason at Luca’s door. Dodger was the best baby monitor there was at night though, because he’d be jumping onto Chris and Sebastian’s bed before the cries got loud enough to wake them up to let them know Luca was up and needing attention.

“Ah, good burp, good for you,” he said. As he put him back into his car seat and buckled him back up. Chris looked up and smiled as he caught a glimpse of the two in his rear view. Sebastian then took a moment to look outside. They were almost home. Another ten minutes and they’d be there.

“Dodger’s here, do you think we should introduce them now?”

“Hey bubba! Hey, yes. I missed you too! I missed you so much,” Dodger happily yipped and jumped and licked at Chris’s face as he greeted him. “Good boy,” Chris said. “Now stay,” Dodger stayed where he was asked. Tail wagging happily. “You are such a good boy, I missed you too, yes I did, you’re the best,” he praised the dog and continued to generously pet him all over. “Now, guess what? We’ve got someone for you to meet, come here,” he said, he clipped Dodger’s leash on him. Dodger looked confused. They knew he’d just been on a walk because their Dog Walker had just updated them that he’d been on one before they came home.

“You’ll see,” he promised the dog. He knocked on the outside door that led to the garage to signal that it was okay for Chris to come inside with the baby. His tail wagging as he got closer to Chris who was holding the carriage up high.

“Dodger, this is your new little brother, do you want to say hi? If so you have to sit,” he told the dog. He’d been around babies before but it was like he was taking extra care around this one. He kept his distance and didn’t put his face into the seat. Staying around the boarder as he sniffed. Luca cooed again, little hands coming out far enough to touch Dodger. Dodger just let the baby gently bat at him. Finally he got closer. His nose gently nudging at Luca’s little head as he sniffed him. Luca’s head moved as he tried to follow the dog’s movements. Neither one seemed distressed. Only curious about one and other. Dodger slowly sniffed down Luca’s little body before sitting down in front of the baby carrier. He tilted his head one way and then another before leaning in again and getting right up into Luca’s face.

He just sniffed again at the top of Luca’s head before sitting back and then looking up at Chris. A wide doggy smile on his face. As if to say “I like it, what is it? Are we keeping it?” All in one. Dodger, the poor pup, had only been able to take so much before retreating outside to his Doghouse. It wasn’t colic and Sebastian and Chris were glad of that. They’d done all they could think of. He didn’t need a change, he didn’t want food, didn’t need to be burped, rocked, held, or anything else. It was breaking Chris’s heart to have to watch and was quite frankly, driving Sebastian slightly mad. But he remained calm. Doing all he could think of. Currently Luca was in his carrier on the floor, still bawling his little hands and legs flailing as he did so. Chris came in from Dodger’s morning walk. Unlike usual for the past few days Dodger didn’t immediately head outside. This time he slowly and cautiously walked up to the carriage. Chris was about to call him back but Dodger didn’t bark or pounce, he instead placed his paw on it and began to rock it slightly. Still crying, Luca opened his eyes. And for the first time in a few hours he paused in his crying. His hands coming out and reaching for the dog. Dodger moves forward. He began licking Luca’s head and Luca’s little fists fisted themselves in his fur. Dodger pulled away and stopped licking but he sat down, resting his body over the baby carrier completely and just lying there. Chris and Sebastian watched on with awe as Luca slowly stopped crying his cries fading to quiet whimpers and then silence before soft and content cooing sounds replaced them as Luca continued to run his little hands through Dodger’s fur.

“Well would you look at that?” Chris commented coming over to Sebastian. Sebastian was still shocked himself.

“You couldn’t have tried this three days ago Dodge?” He wondered aloud. Chris laughed,

“He’s a Good boy,”

“That he is,” Sebastian said as he sighed. Closing his eyes for a moment and relishing in the silence for the first time in days.

-

From then on whenever Luca would start wailing Dodger would come running. If Luca was crying in his crib Dodger would stick a paw or a snout through the bars and as soon as Luca saw him he’d begin to calm down. It was almost like magic. When Luca would be playing on his play mat during the day dodger would sit and watch from his spot close by where the sun would shine in through the window. When Luca would push a ball a little out of his reach (before he started crawling) Dodger would be sure to nudge it back before the whimpering started.

Dodger was taking his duties as big brother very seriously and it warmed Chris’s heart the most to see baby and dog bonding so well.

The only place they drew the line at was when Luca was sleeping at night. Dodger wasn’t allowed in the room and there was a baby gate that opened and closed for that reason at Luca’s door. Dodger was the best baby monitor there was at night though, because he’d be jumping onto Chris and Sebastian’s bed before the cries got loud enough to wake them up to let them know Luca was up and needing attention.

title: A Walk in the Park
body:
Chapter 17 part 2

Description: When your husband dies in an accident, you try to move on with your life. When the memories of your shared home become too much even after two years, you make a drastic change and move to California. A new career, a new way of life, and an attractive new friend help you move on to find the happiness you need.

Pairings: Chris Evans x Reader    

Warnings for this chapter:  Fluff! All the fluff! A little cursing. It’s me, you should expect that by now.

A/N: This is a little bit of a different chapter and you’ll now understand why I separated it from the first half of chapter 17. It’s also longer than I thought it would be, but I’m sure no one is mad about that. When I heard the song What a Time by Julia Michaels (ft. Niall Horan) I knew I had to throw it into this series somewhere as some of the lyrics really relate. Give it a listen.

Song Lyrics are in bold below. I didn’t use the whole song, just the ones that pertained to the story. (They aren’t bold in mobile, I apologize that it looks a jumbled mess)

You were out of the shower and dressed in less than 20 minutes. You threw on a pair jeans and a cute wide neck top that exposed one shoulder. Since you had time you styled your hair and put on some light makeup. You put on a pair of sandals, grabbed your key and tucked your phone into your back pocket.

The walk to the park seemed to go a lot faster than it normally did, granted you were normally going for a longer walk that included a trip to the park. You walked up to the fountain and stared at the steady stream of water. You were 15 minutes early. The anticipation of seeing Chris again was getting the best of you. Your heart was beating a thousand times per minute and you had to bite your nails to avoid running your hands through your hair.

I feel a little nauseous and my hands are shaking
I guess that means you’re close by
My throat is getting dry and my heart is racing
I haven’t been by your side
In a minute, but I think about it sometimes
Even though I know it’s not so distant
Oh, no, I still wanna reminisce it


You heard Dodger before you saw him or Chris. He was excitedly barking, running toward you while Chris jogged behind. Chris had a huge smile on his face. He was dressed in jeans and a navy-blue t-shirt. A navy ball cap on his head pulled down low, covering his eyes. But you couldn’t miss that smile. That million-watt smile. Your own smile burst at the seams. You chuckled as they reached you. You wanted to reach for Chris but Dodger bumped you first, putting his paws on your knees. Bending forward you rubbed his face and body before crouching down and accepting his kisses.

Feeling brave all of a sudden. “I guess your not the only one who missed me.”

Chris lowered his head, clearly blushing and then threw it back again. He opened and closed his mouth a few times before he hummed in response.

You took the leash from Chris’ hand as you usually did. You wanted to reach out and take his hand instead, but since he still hadn’t said anything, it didn’t feel right. You started to walk, Chris catching up and walking beside you. Your mind flashed back to the last time you were at the park. The arguing, the tears, the kiss. Maybe this was all too soon. Maybe Chris was uncomfortable.

I know we didn’t end it like we’re supposed to
And now we get a bit tense
I wonder if my mind just leaves out all the bad parts
I know we didn’t make sense
I admit it that I think about it sometimes
Even though I know it’s not so distant
Oh, no, I still wanna reminisce it

 

“Hey.” He places his hand on your shoulder to stop you. “Can we stop for a minute?” His hand slowly slides down your arm until it reaches your hand and all you could do is watch. He takes the leash from you and loops it through his own. He returns his hand to yours and holds it. You nod your head, it’s all you can do. He’s holding your hand. This is what you wanted.

Just breathe. Just breathe.

“I was thinking back to the first time we met. Right here, in this park. I still can’t believe I yelled at you.”

You chuckle. “Me either. Not that it matters, but I had no idea who you were other than this stranger yelling at me. And the only thing I could think about was returning this precious boy to his owner.”

“I need to learn how to read a situation better.” He grins. “This adorable rambling woman threw me through a loop.”

You smack his hand with your free one. “You love it!”

He slowly nods his head. “I kind of actually do.”

You let out a staggered breath and you know he heard it. He squeezes your hand and gives you a soft smile.

“Y/N, you became one of my closest friends in a short period of time. I hope you being here is you saying you want that again. I miss you sweetheart, and I want us back.”

Tears prick the corners of your eyes. You try desperately to hold them in, but there’s no use as a couple escape flowing down your cheeks. Chris reaches with his free hand to wipe them away softly with his thumb. Closing your eyes at the touch of his hand, a few more escape. You feel lips on your forehead. It’s soft and tender and everything you want. Your eyes shoot open to see Chris slowly pulling away.

“I do want that.” You say. He smiles softly. He pulls his hat off and stuffs it in his back pocket. Now you have a clear view of those gorgeous eyes and can see unshed tears. “I wanted to stay angry at you for so long, but you make that pretty damn hard.” He lets out a watery laugh and you squeeze his hand. You look down at your combined hands, too afraid to look him in the eyes. “But you really did hurt me. You can’t do that again. There won’t be another chance. I may seem strong and brave and all that, but I’m not. Not really. I’m still developing this new me and I need people with me who are going to help me flourish, not break me down.”

It’s his turn to let out a ragged breath. You look up to see those unshed tears streaming down his face. Lifting your hand to wipe them away, he grabs it with his free hand and shakes his head. “Never again. I’m a fool. I was an asshole and I’ll never be that way to you again. I need you in my life and I promise to talk to you about what I’m feeling. I should have from the beginning. I think about game night and how I just ignored you like you were an extra guest someone just brought.”

He’s rambling and you can’t take it anymore. Not that it’s not important, but your heart has already forgiven him and you want to move on, but you want more. Your eyes slowly drift to his lips. They’re moving but you can’t concentrate on what they’re saying. You feel bad, you really do. You’ll ask him to repeat it later, but it’s your turn to make that big move. Maybe it’s a mistake. Maybe this will be the end, but it’s what you want and taking chances has been your thing since the day you put your house up for sale.

You pull both hands away from his and he looks shocked for a moment. His eyes slowly turn to fear and you want nothing more than to soothe him. Slowly your hands reach up to his face. Thumbs caressing his cheeks and your fingers brush against his hairline. He relaxes in your touch and begins to part his lips to speak, but you’re already pulling his face to yours. Holding your breath, you come closer and closer together until your lips touch. It’s soft and patient. Even though your holding his face, you’re gentle enough that he can easily pull away. But he doesn’t. Neither of your lips are moving, they’re just pressed together. The other kiss was hard and hurried. It was pure desperation. This kiss is undemanding and sweet.

You begin to part your lips and press them against his again. Again, he doesn’t pull away, but he remains still and you don’t know what that means. Those negative thoughts make their way into your brain again. This was a mistake. This isn’t what he wants anymore. Maybe he never did want this and he’s just one of those guys who want what they can’t have. But then you feel his hand on your hip and he’s tugging your body against his. His other hand finds the back of your head, fingers weaving into your hair. His mouth parts and you follow suit. Your lips are working in sync and your finally able to release that breath you’d been holding. It comes out as a sigh and you feel his grin against your mouth. You suck in a quick breath and capture his lips once more. Your noses are bumping each other but neither of you care as you seem to fit together better the more you continue to kiss.

I think of the night in the park, it was getting dark
And we stayed up for hours
What a time, what a time, what a time
You clinged to my body like you wanted it forever
What a time, what a time, what a time
For you and I
What a time, what a time
For you and I

 

Out of breath once again, you pull your face away slowly and lean your forehead against his. He’s breathing heavy, eyes closed, but all you can see is his flushed cheeks and nose. You lick your lips and release your hands from his face settling them on his shoulders, slowly sliding them down his chest. One hand still on your hip and the other holding your head. He pulls your lips to his once again for a kiss. It’s short and over way too soon, but it’s everything. He initiated it. He wanted it.

The hand that was holding your head finds its way to your other hip and he squeezes it. You’ve both pulled back some so that you can study each other’s faces. His face is still flushed and you don’t doubt that yours is as well. His eyes are shiny but they seem happy. You wonder what you look like and you hope he knows that you are happy as well.

“I didn’t mean to interrupt what you were saying, but I really needed to do that. I hope you don’t mind.”

He quirks a bashful smile and hums in response. “No. I don’t think I minded that one bit.”

“You see, I do miss us, and I do want us back. But..”

His thumbs are rubbing soothing circles on your hips and it’s distracting you in the best way. Your hands are still pressed against his chest, but they start to ever so slightly move up and down.

“But?” He asks. His voice is soft, barely above a whisper. The warm glow of the sun on his face and all you can think about is how this strong, handsome man had tears in his eyes and kissed you back.

“But, I want more.” He smiles and captures your lips with his once again. You pull back and he pouts. You push on his chest and he lets out a chuckle. “I want to try being together, but I don’t want games. I don’t want to see anyone else. I want to give us a real chance. At least that’s what I want.”

Maybe I’ve said too much. Me and my stupid mouth.

“I want that too. I don’t need to see anyone else. But I want to do this right. I want to take you out, wine and dine you.”

You shake your head and let out a little giggle. “You know I don’t need all that.”

“Oh, I know. Give you pizza and you’re a happy girl. But let me woo you. Please.”

You smile big and nod. You grab his face once again and kiss his nose. He sighs, pulling back to kiss your forehead.

“Can you just promise that you won’t shave unless its for a movie?” You grab his bearded face with your hand.

He lets out a big huff of a laugh. “I can promise that.”

For you and I
For you and I
For you and I
What a time, what a time for you and I
What a time for you and I, yeah
What a time, what a time for you and I


Tag List: @lookwhatyoumademequeue @the–blackdahlia @crimeshowtrash @flamencodiva @cocomel0613 @thefandomzoneisdangerous @maddie-laufeyson @ly-cia @shameless-pope @tessvillegas @pivans @symonlyjen5 @inlovewith3 @humandasaster @sleepylunarwolf @fanfiiiiiiics @violetadefebrero @not-another-tmblr @thenormreedus @joannie95 @estillion14 @smoothdogsgirl @chita0027

You were out of the shower and dressed in less than 20 minutes. You threw on a pair jeans and a cute wide neck top that exposed one shoulder. Since you had time you styled your hair and put on some light makeup. You put on a pair of sandals, grabbed your key and tucked your phone into your back pocket.

[[MORE]]

The walk to the park seemed to go a lot faster than it normally did, granted you were normally going for a longer walk that included a trip to the park. You walked up to the fountain and stared at the steady stream of water. You were 15 minutes early. The anticipation of seeing Chris again was getting the best of you. Your heart was beating a thousand times per minute and you had to bite your nails to avoid running your hands through your hair.

I feel a little nauseous and my hands are shaking
I guess that means you’re close by
My throat is getting dry and my heart is racing
I haven’t been by your side
In a minute, but I think about it sometimes
Even though I know it’s not so distant
Oh, no, I still wanna reminisce it


You heard Dodger before you saw him or Chris. He was excitedly barking, running toward you while Chris jogged behind. Chris had a huge smile on his face. He was dressed in jeans and a navy-blue t-shirt. A navy ball cap on his head pulled down low, covering his eyes. But you couldn’t miss that smile. That million-watt smile. Your own smile burst at the seams. You chuckled as they reached you. You wanted to reach for Chris but Dodger bumped you first, putting his paws on your knees. Bending forward you rubbed his face and body before crouching down and accepting his kisses.

Feeling brave all of a sudden. “I guess your not the only one who missed me.”

Chris lowered his head, clearly blushing and then threw it back again. He opened and closed his mouth a few times before he hummed in response.

You took the leash from Chris’ hand as you usually did. You wanted to reach out and take his hand instead, but since he still hadn’t said anything, it didn’t feel right. You started to walk, Chris catching up and walking beside you. Your mind flashed back to the last time you were at the park. The arguing, the tears, the kiss. Maybe this was all too soon. Maybe Chris was uncomfortable.

I know we didn’t end it like we’re supposed to
And now we get a bit tense
I wonder if my mind just leaves out all the bad parts
I know we didn’t make sense
I admit it that I think about it sometimes
Even though I know it’s not so distant
Oh, no, I still wanna reminisce it

 

“Hey.” He places his hand on your shoulder to stop you. “Can we stop for a minute?” His hand slowly slides down your arm until it reaches your hand and all you could do is watch. He takes the leash from you and loops it through his own. He returns his hand to yours and holds it. You nod your head, it’s all you can do. He’s holding your hand. This is what you wanted.

Just breathe. Just breathe.

“I was thinking back to the first time we met. Right here, in this park. I still can’t believe I yelled at you.”

You chuckle. “Me either. Not that it matters, but I had no idea who you were other than this stranger yelling at me. And the only thing I could think about was returning this precious boy to his owner.”

“I need to learn how to read a situation better.” He grins. “This adorable rambling woman threw me through a loop.”

You smack his hand with your free one. “You love it!”

He slowly nods his head. “I kind of actually do.”

You let out a staggered breath and you know he heard it. He squeezes your hand and gives you a soft smile.

“Y/N, you became one of my closest friends in a short period of time. I hope you being here is you saying you want that again. I miss you sweetheart, and I want us back.”

Tears prick the corners of your eyes. You try desperately to hold them in, but there’s no use as a couple escape flowing down your cheeks. Chris reaches with his free hand to wipe them away softly with his thumb. Closing your eyes at the touch of his hand, a few more escape. You feel lips on your forehead. It’s soft and tender and everything you want. Your eyes shoot open to see Chris slowly pulling away.

“I do want that.” You say. He smiles softly. He pulls his hat off and stuffs it in his back pocket. Now you have a clear view of those gorgeous eyes and can see unshed tears. “I wanted to stay angry at you for so long, but you make that pretty damn hard.” He lets out a watery laugh and you squeeze his hand. You look down at your combined hands, too afraid to look him in the eyes. “But you really did hurt me. You can’t do that again. There won’t be another chance. I may seem strong and brave and all that, but I’m not. Not really. I’m still developing this new me and I need people with me who are going to help me flourish, not break me down.”

It’s his turn to let out a ragged breath. You look up to see those unshed tears streaming down his face. Lifting your hand to wipe them away, he grabs it with his free hand and shakes his head. “Never again. I’m a fool. I was an asshole and I’ll never be that way to you again. I need you in my life and I promise to talk to you about what I’m feeling. I should have from the beginning. I think about game night and how I just ignored you like you were an extra guest someone just brought.”

He’s rambling and you can’t take it anymore. Not that it’s not important, but your heart has already forgiven him and you want to move on, but you want more. Your eyes slowly drift to his lips. They’re moving but you can’t concentrate on what they’re saying. You feel bad, you really do. You’ll ask him to repeat it later, but it’s your turn to make that big move. Maybe it’s a mistake. Maybe this will be the end, but it’s what you want and taking chances has been your thing since the day you put your house up for sale.

You pull both hands away from his and he looks shocked for a moment. His eyes slowly turn to fear and you want nothing more than to soothe him. Slowly your hands reach up to his face. Thumbs caressing his cheeks and your fingers brush against his hairline. He relaxes in your touch and begins to part his lips to speak, but you’re already pulling his face to yours. Holding your breath, you come closer and closer together until your lips touch. It’s soft and patient. Even though your holding his face, you’re gentle enough that he can easily pull away. But he doesn’t. Neither of your lips are moving, they’re just pressed together. The other kiss was hard and hurried. It was pure desperation. This kiss is undemanding and sweet.

You begin to part your lips and press them against his again. Again, he doesn’t pull away, but he remains still and you don’t know what that means. Those negative thoughts make their way into your brain again. This was a mistake. This isn’t what he wants anymore. Maybe he never did want this and he’s just one of those guys who want what they can’t have. But then you feel his hand on your hip and he’s tugging your body against his. His other hand finds the back of your head, fingers weaving into your hair. His mouth parts and you follow suit. Your lips are working in sync and your finally able to release that breath you’d been holding. It comes out as a sigh and you feel his grin against your mouth. You suck in a quick breath and capture his lips once more. Your noses are bumping each other but neither of you care as you seem to fit together better the more you continue to kiss.

I think of the night in the park, it was getting dark
And we stayed up for hours
What a time, what a time, what a time
You clinged to my body like you wanted it forever
What a time, what a time, what a time
For you and I
What a time, what a time
For you and I

 

Out of breath once again, you pull your face away slowly and lean your forehead against his. He’s breathing heavy, eyes closed, but all you can see is his flushed cheeks and nose. You lick your lips and release your hands from his face settling them on his shoulders, slowly sliding them down his chest. One hand still on your hip and the other holding your head. He pulls your lips to his once again for a kiss. It’s short and over way too soon, but it’s everything. He initiated it. He wanted it.

The hand that was holding your head finds its way to your other hip and he squeezes it. You’ve both pulled back some so that you can study each other’s faces. His face is still flushed and you don’t doubt that yours is as well. His eyes are shiny but they seem happy. You wonder what you look like and you hope he knows that you are happy as well.

“I didn’t mean to interrupt what you were saying, but I really needed to do that. I hope you don’t mind.”

He quirks a bashful smile and hums in response. “No. I don’t think I minded that one bit.”

“You see, I do miss us, and I do want us back. But..”

His thumbs are rubbing soothing circles on your hips and it’s distracting you in the best way. Your hands are still pressed against his chest, but they start to ever so slightly move up and down.

“But?” He asks. His voice is soft, barely above a whisper. The warm glow of the sun on his face and all you can think about is how this strong, handsome man had tears in his eyes and kissed you back.

“But, I want more.” He smiles and captures your lips with his once again. You pull back and he pouts. You push on his chest and he lets out a chuckle. “I want to try being together, but I don’t want games. I don’t want to see anyone else. I want to give us a real chance. At least that’s what I want.”

Maybe I’ve said too much. Me and my stupid mouth.

“I want that too. I don’t need to see anyone else. But I want to do this right. I want to take you out, wine and dine you.”

You shake your head and let out a little giggle. “You know I don’t need all that.”

“Oh, I know. Give you pizza and you’re a happy girl. But let me woo you. Please.”

You smile big and nod. You grab his face once again and kiss his nose. He sighs, pulling back to kiss your forehead.

“Can you just promise that you won’t shave unless its for a movie?” You grab his bearded face with your hand.

He lets out a big huff of a laugh. “I can promise that.”

For you and I
For you and I
For you and I
What a time, what a time for you and I
What a time for you and I, yeah
What a time, what a time for you and I
